snippet: The Moscow Patriarchate’s decision highlighted tensions between the Russian branch and a rival leadership based in Istanbul.
abstract: Russian Orthodox Church says it will not take part in historic gathering of Orthodox churches on Greek island of Crete, dealing blow to effort to unite Orthodox Christians around world; doctrinal disputes and rivalry between Moscow and Istanbul churches may be to blame.
lead_paragraph: The Moscow Patriarchate’s decision highlighted tensions between the Russian branch and a rival leadership based in Istanbul.

headline.main: Orthodox Churches’ Council, Centuries in Making, Falters as Russia Exits
headline.print_headline: Gathering of Orthodox Churches Falters as Russia Bows Out
